author: Mohammed Ghazal
comment: Dropping the support for your previous watches like this!! I was an early adopter of LG G Watch R, which is still new and now no support by you (No Apps and no WiFi) although it has the same hardware as your Urbane watch. Believe me if it was not Google who still support us by updating Android Wear, we must have been left alone for along time by you. The most important factor in consumer market is after sale support, which you clearly lack. Sorry LG.
title: This will be my last product from LG

author: M Pinson
comment: Works well with watch urbane and lg3. Still need phone close by to make calls but you can receive and dial without a problem. If you have trouble seeing your contacts on the watch update your google plus contacts and mark them with the star. That should make them visisble on your watch. Add the speaker app to active your phone speaker on incoming calls. Handy if you are driving without a headset and phone is out of reach. Similar to car blue tooth sync to phone.
title: Almost perfect

author: Mark Maguire
comment: It took a couple of reboots on phone and watch but it works great. Download the app onto your phone, you do not need to open it and it doesn't appear in your app tray, although you can see it in your 'my app' as a downloaded app. I think I rebooted the watch 3 times and the phone once to get it all synced. App is neat with some handy features which work well.
title: Works perfectly on g watch r

author: Nicolas Curchod
comment: works perfectly on G Watch R since the 5.1.1 update and with a bluetooth headset : perfect ... my phone stay in my pocket.  for the whinners...  1. i bought my GWR cheaper than the Moto 360 because i thought she was better, well for 50chf less than the M360: she is every bit better than that one, round screen better battery life, better looking .(she always was cheaper and better than the M360)  2. updates are due and arrive at one point or another, for the WIFI stop complaining, it's due in september update. (not that wifi will bring a lot of things but still a nice addition.)  instead of whinning stay informed about the news on your devices ....

author: Bob Duerr
comment: There are no settings nor does Wear show it as an installed app.  When I first installed it, it popped up on my phone constantly and seemed to pop if I touched the bottom of the screen.   It seems to have settled down now but without any visible sign of an installation it needs setup and controlls  its nice to be able to dial a number or call from fav's or contacts so it is useful just frustraiting
title: No settings and seems to pop up from bottom

comment: The app isn't working for Android 6.0 Marshmallow on my dual Sims Lenovo Vibe P1. Because Android chooses only one sim or will ask which sim to use. So I have to take my phone out to make the call. Worked perfectly on Lollipop. Please fix this.
title: Not working for Marshmallow

author: Prince Williams
comment: I actually initially thought this was for the Urbane only and possibly the R; but when I looked on the description LG makes it seem as if at very least it'll work on all LG Android Wear devices (and honestly it's phrased as if it work on any). This could've been easily avoided by LG by stating CLEARLY for the Urbane only.
title: Misleading for no reason

author: JDs1469
comment: Who cares if I can start a call on the watch if I just have to pull my phone out of my pocket for the call. It's not like its easier to make the call on my watch than my phone. So I have to ask; what is the point of this?
title: What is the point?

author: Rob Clapham
comment: Description says "Make a call on your wrist" in which reality does this mean "you can't really do this, use your phone to make the call?" Disappointing to say the least. Change the description to be unambiguous - say clearly that the watch cannot be used as a phone.
title: This app description is blatantly untrue

author: James Kemble
comment: Does not work on G Watch R UNTIL it has been updated to 5.1.1 everyone calm down. I got the update today and it works fine.....  Oh and LG, enable Wifi for me please....
title: Update your description LG

author: Evan Batterman
comment: In short....works perfectly, but its pointless.  "Who cares if I can start a call on the watch if I just have to pull my phone out of my pocket for the call. It's not like its easier to make the call on my watch than my phone. So I have to ask; what is the point of this?"

author: Mark Cash
comment: The point of this app is, you DO NOT have to pull out your phone at all, just pair a bluetooth headset to your watch, and your all set. You people low rate apps you don't understand or to ignorant to figure out.
title: JD Morecraft

author: Mustansir Nurbhai
comment: I have an Urbane and I simply do not see what this app is supposed to be used for? Google now allows me to do exactly the same thing without this app? It's not possible to actually talk and hear through the watch. Don't waste your time installing this.
title: I don't understand the point of this app?

author: NettersTX1
comment: I downloaded the Wear Speaker app and use Bluetooth headphones and it works fine now. Wish I'd known that the app was needed. Could have saved me a lot of headaches. If you purchase the Wear Speaker, you get to select your favorites, dial, hang up, choose a color background, and more. I can now call, talk, and hang up the phone on my LG G.
title: Works on LG W100

author: Ben Wood
comment: .......didn't work at all B$ a re install on phone and a restart on watch. Now get list of recent, favs etc and dialler but doesn't actually dial out on Note 4.......any tips?
title: Nearly getting there......

author: alfred rodriguez
comment: What does this save you from if you still need to pick the phone up to talk? If your driving you are looking at your wrist so no use there. If you at the office you still need to pull the phone out to talk.
title: Useless

author: Ricardo V.
comment: So, the offensive decision to make this app only for the new watch was changed, good. Still the same thing with the wifi, I'm never buying an LG product ever again because of this, I supported this greedy company with a $300 watch so they try to force me to buy the same watch again with a small cosmetic change. Stay classy. 1 star because it's not that you rob me and then just give me my stuff back, it's that you're not supposed to  rob me at all.
title: Good game LG

author: andrew marsh
comment: ' Make a call on your wrist '... NO YOU CANNOT. I have the LG urbane. Downloaded this app thinking it would be great. What a waste of time! Start a call with the watch but have to get your phone out to talk! Bloody useless without a microphone on the watch, easier just to get ur phone out of ur pocket as per usual!
title: What's the point! Misleading title!

author: Paul Wright
comment: But this app seems pointless it makes it sound like you can make a call without getting the phone out, but there is no speaker on the watch to allow this! :-(
title: I have the LG urbane

author: Raymil Manichand
comment: Useless app!  Why bother downloading an app if you still have to take the phone out of your pocket. Not a smart move for a smartwatch.......
title: Not "Smart" LG....?

author: Richard Parangi
comment: Stock software was sufficient. FIX the WiFi compatibility issue and stop brushing it off as a useless function. No of course I won't leave my phone at home BUT everything in my house, office and car with a remote can be networked and controlled via WiFi. I've got a watch with the internals of a 2010 super computer but I can't use it to turn up the TV or open the garage door. G watch R
title: Does nothing extra

comment: Well it could have been more specific.. The calls are initiated on your mobile.. and its not even close to Samsung 1st gen watches where you can use watch alone to complete conversation..
title: Does what it says

author: John Wood
comment: This initiates a call on your phone. You then need to pick up the phone to speak to whoever you just called. What, exactly, is the point then? Answers on a postcard please.
title: Fantastically pointless

author: Wayne Pederick
comment: Needs work, had to add all my contacts and groups into my favorite's to get things to display correctly on my watch. Would also like to see letters as well as numbers on the dialer. I am enjoying the product  😊
title: LG call

author: Crystal Rowcliffe
comment: Only uninstalled it in this 5 times and putting it back on my watch I finally got it where I can call out I got a LG Urban watch. I love it but been trying to call out and it kept telling me I have to stall on my phone watch I did 5 times. But today I uninstalled it one last time and now it is finally working don't know why that was happening but I hope it don't happen again.

author: Ira Rosenzweig
comment: Works perfect. For those who own a Note 4, and complained that it's not working : When using  to call from your watch the first time, with the Note 4, one needs to have the Phone And Phone App OPEN. Your Smartphone will ask you if to use this kind of a action ( calling from your LG urban ) with Phone/Skype/Viber etc. Make your choice. And then it will work automatically, from then on.
title: Nice

author: Phil Alford
comment: *Update* So it looks like i was right. You can keep your stars :-) *original* Bad idea to release an app before it's ready, and not title it to make it clear that it only works with a device that's not yet widely available, and not with our other, similar devices. I'm hoping that GW and GWR owners are a software update away from full functionality with this app. Until the 5.1 update arrives on my GWR and it confirms compatibility, I'll give you the benefit of the doubt.
title: Bad Idea

author: John Skeoch
comment: First off I own you an apology, this app is not locked only to the Urbane, it simply requires the 5.1.1 software on the watch.  I would suggest that mentioning that requirement, rather than calling out the Urbane specifically might have gone some way to avoiding mine and others confusion and resultant anger.  I included the 'ish' because I'm still holding on to a healthy dose of anger as a result of your decision not to get the FCC to approve the GWR for wifi, despite fully working chip/antenna. Still smacks of trying to force users to upgrade.
title: UPDATE: Eating humble-ish pie

author: Jeffrey Klassen
comment: Works awesome when you wear bluetooth headphones/headset and don't need to touch your phone to make a call. Gives access to recent and favorites which is the most useful.  LG needs better communication skills to avoid the fiasco that happened.
title: Good app. GWR.

author: Casey Jordan
comment: How are you guys going to release a calling app for ONE version of your wear devices? You have an adoption rate so high in your previous watches that you would make a lot of people happy.
title: Incompatibility... 😡

author: Roschmann Godinho
comment: All these ppl complaining about having to remove their phones for calls have never heard of Bluetooth/wired headsets. App works great. Makes it super convenient with a headset connected.
title: Good Stuff!

author: Sebastian Cardozo-Valencia
comment: It works well on my watch, no doubt. Yet I really don't see it useful if I can have a conversation through the watch. If it's only going to iniciate the calls, then just might as well take out my phone out of the pocket and dial. Hope you guys can improe that little thing.
title: Needs to get better

author: Benji Kearton
comment: Does say In description 'supports: android 4.3+ (paired with lg watch urbane)' its not right at the top but its there. Try reading the whole app description before getting butt hurt

author: Christopher Kim
comment: When trying to access on my watch,  it tells me to download the app on my phone.  Installed,  uninstalled, installed,  restarted phone and watch,  still tells me the same thing. I have the galaxy note edge.
title: Doesn't even work on my urbane with 5.1.1

author: Stewart Boling
comment: Once again burned for being an early adopter and pre-ordering the G Watch. If the issue of not supporting the G Watch and GWR is that the app requires Android Wear 5.1.1 please just tell us instead of leaving us in the dark and assuming that you are no longer supporting your first two Android Wear devices. If the reason you are not supporting the GW and GWR is that you are trying to drive sales of the Urbane then that is despicable  and you have lost a customer.
title: No support for LG G watch

author: Elzafir Habsjah
comment: EDIT: It now works on G Watch R running Lollipop 5.1. But still, the GWR is being left out by LG by nit giving it wi-fi feature with the latest update, even though it's the exact same hardware as the Urbane.      ->Original comment: For shame, LG. For shame! No support for the six months old G Watch R, which has the exact same internals as the Urbane! EVERYBODY, LET'S DOWNVOTE THIS APP TO OBLIVION!
title: Installed just to give this 1-star!

author: John Butler
comment: LG appear to be taking a little extra profit now, but will pay dearly for the privilege on all future wear products! At a time when android wear needs to present a professional front, to compete with the iwatch, LG's fiasco has done untold damage. I appear to one amongst many early adopters who will skip quickly past LG products when it comes to my next tech purchase!
title: LG G watch R rip off!

author: CJ Laing
comment: The description says that it works with android wear devices, however it fails to mention that it does not work on all devices and only works on the Urbane. Was very disappointed to learn that I couldn't have this beautiful dialer ui on my G Watch.
title: Misleading

author: Daniel Follweiler
comment: Don't see why I need this, but there was an icon for it after the 5.1.1 update so I installed it. Everyone is complaining about LG not enabling Wi-Fi on the R, but I don't see why this is an issue. Is anyone actually going to try to replace their phone with a watch? Or will you carry it anyway? Just use Bluetooth then.
title: Works fine G Watch R

author: Flavien Brun Ducret
comment: At least you have a pseudo excuse for the WiFi on the G Watch R (even if it's a lie).  But limiting this app to the Urbane is like spiting in your customers face. I'll never buy an LG product again, and being the "geek"  my friends and family come to see for advice I'll make sure everyone know about your "marketing strategies".
title: Edit: works now leave the text for history 😊
